definition.sentence: Spanish-English machine translation ( SPANAM ) has been operational at the Pan American Health Organization ( PAHO ) since 1980 .
definition.definiens: operational at the Pan American Health Organization ( PAHO ) since 1980

definition.sentence: Also written in PL/I , ENGSPAN uses essentially the same modular system architecture that has been developed for SPANAM , but it is conceived on the basis of up-to-date linguistic theory leading to rule-based strategies for the parsing of syntactic and semantic information .
definition.definiens: uses essentially the same modular system architecture that has been developed for SPANAM , but it is conceived on the basis of up-to-date linguistic theory leading to rule-based strategies for the parsing of syntactic and semantic information

definition.sentence: 124 Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Numbers 2-3 , April-September 1985 Muriel Vasconcellos and Marjorie Le6n SPANAM and ENGSPAN The multifaceted approach to post-editing is an important feature of SPANAM .
definition.definiens: an important feature of SPANAM

definition.sentence: For this reason , the result is often quite satisfactory , even compared with a translation that Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Numbers 2-3 , April-September 1985 125 Muriel Vasconcellos and Marjorie Leon SPANAM and ENGSPAN is syntactically more `` faithful '' ( see Section 6 below and also Vasconcellos , in preparation ) • The examples below compare QFPs with solutions that were actually proposed by translator-post-editors ( traditional human translation THT ) .
Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Numbers 2-3 , April-September 1985 127 Muriel Vasconcellos and Marjorie Le6n SPANAM and ENGSPAN SPANAM was originally designed as a direct translation system .
definition.definiens: a direct translation system

definition.sentence: ENGSPAN is a lexical and syntactic transfer system based on the slot-and-filler approach to language structure .
definition.definiens: a lexical and syntactic transfer system based on the slot-and-filler approach to language structure

definition.sentence: `` Not-found '' words are initially considered to be nouns and given the possibility of also functioning as verbs and adjectives .
definition.definiens: nouns and given the possibility of also functioning as verbs and adjectives

definition.sentence: Microglossaries are in use for special translations of terms in the fields of law , finance , sanitary engineering , statistics , and scientific research .
The transfer unit is a rule that is stored in the source dictionary and is retrieved after the analysis of the sentence has been completed .
definition.definiens: a rule that is stored in the source dictionary and is retrieved after the analysis of the sentence has been completed

definition.sentence: A transfer unit contains a condition to be tested and an action to be performed .
definition.definiens: contains a condition to be tested and an action to be performed

definition.sentence: The procedure consists of a series of morphological spellout rules ; raising , lowering , diphthongization , and deletion rules based on phonological processes ; stress assignment rules ; and orthographic rules to handle predictable spelling changes .
The AU is an entry in the source dictionary but has no counterpart in the target dictionary .
definition.definiens: an entry in the source dictionary but has no counterpart in the target dictionary

definition.sentence: The ENGSPAN algorithm performs a top-down , left-toright sequential parse using a combination of chronological and explicit backtracking .
definition.definiens: performs a top-down , left-toright sequential parse using a combination of chronological and explicit backtracking

definition.sentence: The PHRED ( PHRasal English Diction ) system is a language generation module for natural language interfaces .
The principal knowledge structure used by PHRAN and PHRED is the pattern-concept pair , which links a phrasal pattern to a conceptual template .
definition.definiens: links a phrasal pattern to a conceptual template

definition.sentence: The shared linguistic knowledge base is an unusual feature of PHRED and PHRAN .

PHRED , along with its companion analysis program PHRAN , embodies an approach to natural language processing founded on the principle that knowledge about language is in essence declarative , consisting of associations between linguistic and conceptual structures of varying degrees of specificity ( Wilensky 1981 ) .
definition.definiens: embodies an approach to natural language processing founded on the principle that knowledge about language is in essence declarative , consisting of associations between linguistic and conceptual structures of varying degrees of specificity ( Wilensky 1981 )

definition.sentence: The PHRAN analyzer receives the user 's input and passes a conceptual interpretation to UC , which then passes its response in conceptual form to PHRED to be Converted into natural language output .
definition.definiens: receives the user 's input and passes a conceptual interpretation to UC , which then passes its response in conceptual form to PHRED to be Converted into natural language output

definition.sentence: The above PC pair can be used by PHRED , depending on the concept being expressed , to produce the sentence You shouM remove the files from your directory , or the infinitive phrase to remove a file from the top level directory .
definition.definiens: depending on the concept being expressed , to produce the sentence You shouM remove the files from your directory , or the infinitive phrase to remove a file from the top level directory

definition.sentence: The production of an utterance in PHRED is a recursive process which can be divided into three phases : • Fetching is the retrieval of pattern-concept pairs from the knowledge base .
definition.definiens: a recursive process which can be divided into three phases : • Fetching is the retrieval of pattern-concept pairs from the knowledge base

definition.sentence: • Interpretation is the generation of lexical items that match the constraints of the restricted pattern .
definition.definiens: the generation of lexical items that match the constraints of the restricted pattern

definition.sentence: For this purpose , PHRED uses a hashing scheme designed to produce an ordering , or stream , of candidate patterns with a minimum of computation .
definition.definiens: uses a hashing scheme designed to produce an ordering , or stream

definition.sentence: The fetching mechanism produces a stream of pattern-concept pairs which are returned one at a time as they are requested by the generator .
definition.definiens: produces a stream of pattern-concept pairs which are returned one at a time as they are requested by the generator

Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces reflect that the gender of the NP is the gender of its NP2 This property is not determined until the head noun is chosen , after which it can be retrieved through the NP if necessary .
definition.definiens: the subject of a passive infinitive phrase and the past participle , maintains the `` gender = ( value 2 ) '' property to Computational Linguistics , Volume 1 I , Number 4 , October-December 1985 225 Paul S. definition.sentence: In this case , PHRED selects another pattern with the verb cause .
definition.definiens: selects another pattern with the verb cause

definition.sentence: This yields the following result : ***RESTRICTING*** PATTERN : < and root = type form = progressive > < and command-spec concept = ( command ( name rm ) ( args ( filename ) ) ) > PROPERTIES : p-o-s = act-phrase Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Number 4 , October-December 1985 229 Paul S. Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces The combination of the `` type '' pattern with the gerund ordering satisfies the necessary constraints , producing a twoconstituent pattern which then proceeds to the interpretation phase : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and p-o-s = verb root = type form = progressive > < and command-spec concept = ( command ( name rm ) ( args ( filename ) ) ) > PHRED recursively invokes the interpretation procedure on each of the two constituents , starting with the progressive verb : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and p-o-s = verb root = type form = progressive > ***FETCHING*** p-o-s = verb form = progressive root = type This fetch uses a hash on the root and form of the verb given to retrieve the progressive form typing , whose properties unify trivially with the given constraints : ***RESTRICTING*** PATTERN : < word = typing > PROPERTIES : form = progressive p-o-s -- -verb ***INTERPRETING*** PA'I~ERN : < word = typing > PROPERTIES : root = type p-o-s = verb root = type form = progressive The word typing and its properties are now completely specified , so no further restriction is needed .
definition.definiens: a hash on the root and form of the verb given to retrieve the progressive form typing , whose properties unify trivially with the given constraints : ***RESTRICTING*** PATTERN : < word = typing > PROPERTIES : form = progressive p-o-s -- -verb ***INTERPRETING*** PA'I~ERN : < word = typing > PROPERTIES : root = type p-o-s = verb root = type form = progressive The word typing and its properties are now completely specified

definition.sentence: These are then used in fetching the appropriate verb form : ***FETCHING*** p-o-s = verb root = cause form = basic person = third number = singular As with typing , hashing results in the retrieval of the correct verb , and restriction is a simple process : ***RESTRICTING*** PATYERN : < word = causes > PROPERTIES : tense = present root = cause ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < word = causes > PROPERTIES : person = third number = singular form = basic Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Number 4 , October-December 1985 231 Paul S. Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces Having completed the specification of the verb causes , PHRED continues its depthfirst interpretation with the third and final top-level constituent , the infinitive phrase : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and p-o-s = inf-phrase concept = ( state-change ***FETCHING*** concept = ( state-change ... ) p-o-s = inf-phrase voice = passive ***FETCHING*** voice = passive ( object filed ( state-name location ) ( from ( inside-of ( object current-directory ) ) ) ( to ( not ( concept ( inside-of ( object current-directory ) ) ) ) ) ) > The first fetch in this case again brings the ordering pattern , the second the `` remove '' pattern .
definition.definiens: a simple process : ***RESTRICTING*** PATYERN : < word = causes > PROPERTIES : tense = present root = cause ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < word = causes > PROPERTIES : person = third number = singular form = basic Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Number 4 , October-December 1985 231 Paul S. Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces Having completed the specification of the verb causes , PHRED continues its depthfirst interpretation with the third and final top-level constituent , the infinitive phrase : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN

definition.sentence: container ) ) ) ) ) ) PROPERTIES : rem-object = ( value 3 ) At this point , the generator is producing an expression for the passive infinitive phrase following the verb causes .

Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces As the interpretation starts with the first constituent of the infinitive phrase , PHRED now must produce a reference to the specified file .
definition.definiens: passes control to the interpretation mechanism , which then proceeds to generate each part of the infinitive phrase pattern : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and physob concept=filel > < and p-o-s = verb root = be form = infinitive >
A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces As the interpretation starts with the first constituent of the infinitive phrase

definition.sentence: ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and physob concept = ( file ( name ( filename ) ) ) PROPERTIES : concept = ... p-o-s = noun-phrase ***FETCHING*** p-o-s = noun-phrase concept = ... PHRED uses a structural formula , directly associated by a PC pair with the concept of a file , to refer to the hypothetical file : ***RESTRICTING*** PATTERN : < word = the > < word = file > < name > CONCEPT : ( file ( name ( filename ) ) ) PROPERTIES : ref = def p-o-s = noun-phrase person = third number = singular name = ( value 3 name ) This pattern is the default reference for files , which is superseded when more information about a given file must be conveyed .
definition.definiens: uses a structural formula

definition.sentence: The second constituent of the infinitive phrase is the infinitive of the verb be : ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < and p-o-s = verb root = be form = infinitive > As with the other verbs , fetching yields the appropriate form : ***FETCHING*** p-o-s = verb root = be form = infinitive ***RESTRICTING*** PATTERN : < word = to > < word = be > PROPERTIES : p-o-s = verb root = be form = infinitive ***INTERPRETING*** PATTERN : < word = to > < word = be > PROPERTIES : voice = active Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Number 4 , October-December 1985 233 Paul S. Jacobs PHRED : A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces The third constituent of the passive infinitive phrase is the past participle of the verb remove , which is interpreted next .
definition.definiens: A Generator for Natural Language Interfaces The third constituent of the passive

definition.sentence: The PC pair makes it easy to encode specialized phrases and constructs to be used by the generator .
definition.definiens: makes it easy to encode specialized phrases and constructs to be used by the generator

definition.sentence: Semantic grammar ( Burton 1976 ) is another representation scheme which , like that of PHRED , facilitates the use of semantic attributes in language processing .
definition.definiens: facilitates the use of semantic attributes in language processing

definition.sentence: Fillmore ( 1979 ) gives arguments for the idea of the structural formula , a phrase or construction that can not be described strictly as the composition of its components but may still have a certain degree of structural freedom .
definition.definiens: gives arguments for the idea of the structural formula , a phrase or

definition.sentence: Since the goal of PHRAN and PHRED is proficient analysis and use of language , the distinction between grammatical and extragrammatical idioms becomes of minor importance .
definition.definiens: proficient analysis and use of language , the distinction between grammatical and extragrammatical idioms becomes of minor importance

definition.sentence: PHRED restricts the use of delete during elaboration by examining the semantic nature of its object .
Selection is the evaluation of an element from the knowledge base .
definition.definiens: the evaluation of an element from the knowledge base

definition.sentence: Intuitively , predisposition is the underlying access process that influences the likelihood of considering a particular word or phrase ; selection is the judgement process which determines whether the word or phrase is appropriate .
definition.definiens: influences the likelihood of considering a particular word or phrase
determines whether the word or phrase is appropriate

definition.sentence: PHRED expresses the message in natural language .
definition.definiens: expresses the message in natural language

definition.sentence: PHRED is a successful implementation of a real-time generation system covering a range of linguistic phenomena , and has served also to open up new ground for further work .
definition.definiens: a successful implementation of a real-time generation system covering a range of linguistic phenomena

definition.sentence: PHRED is a practical language generator for use in natural language interfaces .
In METAL , translation proper consists of four successive phases : Analysis ( parsing ) , Integration , Transfer , and Synthesis ( generation ) .
definition.definiens: consists of four successive phases : Analysis ( parsing ) , Integration , Transfer , and

definition.sentence: Lexical ambiguity ( including homography and polysemy , as well as ambiguity in morphological decomposition ) is tolerated as a natural phenomenon in the system , and is resolved according to a scoring scheme , discussed below , which handles syntactic ambiguity as well .
definition.definiens: a natural phenomenon in the system , and is resolved according to a scoring scheme , discussed below , which handles syntactic ambiguity as well

definition.sentence: The LRC MT system may produce multiple interpretations of the input `` sentence , '' assigning each of them a score , or plausibility factor ( Robinson 1982 ) .
Our Transfer procedures ( which effect the actual translation of SL into TL ) are tightly bound to nodes in the analysis ( parse tree ) structure ( Paxton 1977 ) .
definition.definiens: effect the actual translation of SL into TL ) are tightly bound to nodes in the analysis

definition.sentence: An integral part of the INTERCODER is the `` lexical default '' program that accepts minimal information about the particular entry ( root form and lexical category ) and heuristically encodes most of the remaining necessary features and values .
definition.definiens: the `` lexical default '' program that accepts minimal information about the particular entry ( root form and lexical category

definition.sentence: GRADE uses an annotated tree structure to represent the sentence structure during the translation process .
definition.definiens: uses an annotated tree structure to represent the sentence structure during the translation process

definition.sentence: • Substructure operation part , which specifies the operations for the parts of the annotated tree that match the conditions written in the matching condition part .
definition.definiens: specifies the operations for the parts of the annotated tree that match the conditions written in the matching condition part

definition.sentence: For instance , let us take the case where a grammar writer writes a subgrammar to analyze the case frame of a verb , containing two rewriting rules ; one rule is to construct a VP ( verb phrase ) from a V and NP ( verb and noun phrase ) , and the other is to construct a VP from a V , NP , and PP ( verb , noun phrase , and prepositional phrase ) .
definition.definiens: to construct a VP ( verb phrase ) from a V and NP ( verb and noun phrase ) , and the other is to construct a VP from a V , NP , and

definition.sentence: The following properties are described using the fixed noun format : lexical item word length word stem pronunciation part of speech sub-categorization of part of speech conjugation synonym derivations ( noun , verb , adjective , adverb ) related words subject code lexical entry in the transfer dictionary semantic codes ( for nouns , verbs ) thesaurus codes ( for nouns ) idiomatic expressions case frames ( for verbs , adjectives ) TRANSFER DICTIONARY Different verb usages are discriminated during the analysis phase .
definition.definiens: lexical item word length word stem pronunciation part of speech sub-categorization of part of speech conjugation synonym derivations
for nouns ) idiomatic expressions case frames ( for verbs , adjectives ) TRANSFER DICTIONARY Different verb usages are discriminated during the analysis phase

definition.sentence: ACKNOWLEDGMENT We are deeply indepted to professor Toyoski Nishida ( Kyoto University ) , Mr. Yoshiyuki Sakamoto ( ETL ) , Tsuyoshi Toriumi ( JICST ) , and Masayuki Sato ( JICST ) for taking part in this project , and to many other people from private companies for their help in the development of the system .
definition.definiens: their help in the development of the system

definition.sentence: In spite of its very narrow scope , TAUM-METEO represents an important breakthrough in MT , since it is the only system that currently produces high quality translation without the need for human revision ( although approximately 20 % of the input is rejected ) .
definition.definiens: an important breakthrough in MT

definition.sentence: Ambiguity is a language-internal phenomenon and it is the responsibility of the analysis module to resolve it .
definition.definiens: a language-internal phenomenon

definition.sentence: The TAUM-AVIATION system includes a large-scale grammar of English capable of handling most constructions that occur with some frequency in the sublanguage of maintenance manuals ( Lehrberger 1982 ) .

Selectional restrictions constitute the main semantic mechanism used by the system to eliminate ambiguities of two types : a. structural ambiguities introduced by syntactic rules ; thus the spurious structure proposed by the parser for ( 5 ) is eliminated because the verb drain does not accept as direct object something in the semantic category of plug , b. lexical ambiguity in the semantic properties of certain lexical items ; polysemous words like the noun line ( which can denote either an abstract geometrical object , or physical objects such as conductors ) are frequently disambiguated by selectional restrictions ; for example , in Flush the line , the concrete sense is selected .
definition.definiens: the main semantic mechanism used by the system to eliminate ambiguities of two types : a. structural ambiguities introduced by syntactic rules

definition.sentence: ID/LP grammars involve immediate-dominance rules and linear-order constraints ; more broadly , GPSG systems can also involve feature relationships and metarules ( Gazdar et al. 1985 ) .

However , in order to apply this method , it is necessary to expand out the effects of everything that falls outside the strict context-free format : rule schemas , metarules , ID rules , LP constraints , feature instantiations , casemarking constraints , etc .
definition.definiens: the strict context-free format : rule schemas , metarules , ID rules

definition.sentence: Shieber considers how one might do parsing with ID/LP grammars , which involve two orthogonal kinds of rules .
definition.definiens: considers how one might do parsing with ID/LP grammars , which involve two orthogonal kinds of rules

definition.sentence: Shieber shows how Earley 's ( 1970 ) algorithm for parsing context-free grammars ( CFGs ) can be adapted to use the constraints of ID/LP grammars directly , without the combinatorially explosive step of converting the ID/LP grammar into standard context-free form .
definition.definiens: shows how Earley 's ( 1970 ) algorithm for parsing context-free grammars ( CFGs ) can be adapted to use the constraints of ID/LP grammars directly , without the combinatorially explosive step of converting the ID/LP grammar into standard context-free form

definition.sentence: Since , given the grammar , checking the LP rules takes constant time , the time complexity of the presented algorithm is identical to Earley 's ... . That is , it is O ( I G 12 n3 ) , where I G I is the size of the grammar ( number of ID rules ) and n is the length of the input .
definition.definiens: the length of the input

definition.sentence: The Earley algorithm uses the position of a dot to track .
definition.definiens: uses the position of a dot to track

definition.sentence: An Earley state is a pair \ [ r , i\ ] , where r is a dotted rule and i is an interword position ranging from 0 to the length n of the input string .
definition.definiens: a dotted rule and i is an interword position ranging from 0 to the length n of the input string

definition.sentence: Definition : An unordered CFG ( UCFG ) is a quadruple ( N , E , R , S ) , where ( a ) N is a finite set of nonterminals .

definition.sentence: I.I DATES AND FUNDING SOURCES Founded in 1972 , GETA is one of the laboratories of the Computer Science Department at Grenoble University .
definition.definiendum: I.I DATES AND FUNDING SOURCES Founded
definition.definiens: one of the laboratories of the Computer Science Department at Grenoble University

definition.sentence: The revision effort includes the search for the source of errors encountered .
definition.definiens: includes the search for the source of errors encountered

definition.sentence: Others are of higher level , for example the determination or actualization properties .
Basically , the TRANSF SLLP provides the means to write bilingual multi-choice dictionaries .
A static grammar describes the correspondence between the strings of a natural language and their interface structures .
definition.definiens: describes the correspondence between the strings of a natural language and their interface structures

definition.sentence: ATEF dictionaries use a two-step hash-coding scheme , followed by an ordered-table representation ( for morphs of the same length sharing the same initial or final character ) .
First , a given transformational system ( TS ) has a given store of transformational rules ( TR ) , which operate by substitution .
definition.definiens: has a given store of transformational rules ( TR ) , which operate by substitution

definition.sentence: Ambiguity is a fundamental problem in Natural Language Processing .

Where translation is a fact of life rather than an oddity , it is realized that any translator 's competence is sharply restricted to a few domains ( this is especially true of technical areas ) , and that native fluency in a foreign language does not bestow on one the ability to serve as a translator .
definition.definiens: a foreign language does not bestow on one the ability to serve as a translator

definition.sentence: HAMT refers to a system wherein the computer is responsible for producing the translation per se , but may interact with a human monitor at many stages along the way for example , asking the human to disambiguate a word 's part of speech or meaning , or to indicate where to attach a phrase , or to choose a translation for a word or phrase from among several candidates discovered in the system 's dictionary .
Global scope characterizes a system ( e.g. , METAL ) in which the meaning of a word is determined by its context within a unified analysis of the sentence ( or , rarely , paragraph ) .
definition.definiens: in which the meaning of a word is determined by its context within a unified analysis of the sentence

definition.sentence: Peter Toma , one of the GAT workers , incorporated LATSEC and developed the SYSTRAN system , which in 1970 replaced the IBM Mark II system at the USAF Foreign Technology Division ( FTD ) at Wright Jonathan Slocum A Survey of Machine Translation Patterson AFB , and in 1976 replaced GAT at EURATOM .
definition.definiens: in 1970 replaced the IBM Mark II system at the USAF Foreign Technology Division ( FTD ) at Wright Jonathan Slocum A Survey of Machine Translation Patterson AFB , and in 1976 replaced GAT at EURATOM

definition.sentence: METAL : MECHANICAL TRANSLATION AND ANALYSIS OF LANGUAGES Having had the same opportunity for hindsight , the University of Texas in 1961 used U.S. government funding to establish the Linguistics Research Center , and with it the METAL project , to investigate MT not from Russian but from German into English .
definition.definiens: MECHANICAL TRANSLATION AND ANALYSIS OF LANGUAGES Having had the same opportunity for hindsight , the University of Texas in 1961 used U.S. government funding to establish the Linguistics Research Center , and with it the METAL project , to investigate MT not from Russian but from German into English

definition.sentence: Though U.S. government interest once again languished , the Sprachendienst ( Language Services ) department of Siemens AG in Munich had begun supporting the project , and in 1980 Siemens AG became the sole sponsor .
definition.definiens: Language Services ) department of Siemens AG in Munich had begun supporting the project , and in 1980 Siemens AG became the sole sponsor

definition.sentence: State-of-the-art surveys have been commissioned ( Pierre Isabelle , formerly of TAUM , personal communication ) , but no successor project has yet been established .
definition.definiens: commissioned ( Pierre Isabelle , formerly of TAUM , personal communication ) , but no successor project has yet been established

definition.sentence: This Interactive Translation System ( ITS ) performed global analysis of sentences ( with human assistance ) , and then indirect transfer ( again , with human assistance ) .
definition.definiens: with human assistance ) , and then indirect transfer ( again , with human assistance )

definition.sentence: To MT system users , acceptability is a function of the amount of preand/or post-editing that must be done ( which is also the greatest determinant of cost ) .
definition.definiens: a function of the amount of preand/or post-editing that must be done ( which is also the greatest determinant of cost )

definition.sentence: NASA selected SYSTRAN in 1974 to translate materials relating to the Apollo-Soyuz collaboration , and EURATOM replaced GAT with SYSTRAN in 1976 .
definition.definiens: selected SYSTRAN in 1974 to translate materials relating to the Apollo-Soyuz collaboration , and EURATOM replaced GAT with SYSTRAN in 1976

definition.sentence: The USAF FTD dictionaries number over a million entries ; Bostad ( 1982 ) reports that dictionary updating must be severely constrained , lest a change to one entry disrupt the activities of many others .
definition.definiens: dictionaries number over a million entries

definition.sentence: This approach is not necessarily feasible for all organizations , but Xerox is willing to employ it and claims it also enhances source-text clarity .
definition.definiens: willing to employ it and claims it also enhances source-text clarity

definition.sentence: METEO TAUM-METEO is the world 's only example of a truly fully-automatic MT system .
METEO scans the network traffic for English weather reports , translates them `` directly '' into French , and sends the translations back out over the communications network automatically .
definition.definiens: scans the network traffic for English weather reports , translates them `` directly '' into French , and sends the translations back out over the communications network automatically

definition.sentence: Thus , the Weidner system accepts a formatted source document ( actually , one containing formatting or typesetting codes ) and produces a formatted translation .
definition.definiens: accepts a formatted source document ( actually , one containing formatting or typesetting codes

definition.sentence: SPANAM Following a promising feasibility study , the Pan American Health Organization in Washington , D.C. decided in 1975 to undertake work on a machine translation system , utilizing some of the same techniques developed for GAT .
definition.definiens: Following a promising feasibility study , the Pan American Health Organization in Washington , D.C. decided in 1975 to undertake work on a machine translation system , utilizing some of the same techniques developed for GAT

definition.sentence: Since 1980 , SPANAM has been used to translate well over a million words of text , averaging about 4,000 words per day per post-editor .
definition.definiens: used to translate well over a million words of text , averaging about 4,000 words per day per post-editor

definition.sentence: A follow-on project to develop ENGSPAN ( for English-Spanish ) , underway since 1981 , has also delivered a production system this one characterized by a more advanced design ( e.g. , an ATN parser ) , some features of which may find their way into SPANAM .
definition.definiens: has also delivered a production system this one characterized by a more advanced design ( e.g. , an ATN parser ) , some features of which may find their way into SPANAM

definition.sentence: Fujitsu ( Sawai et al. 1982 ) , Hitachi , Toshiba ( Amano 1982 ) , and NEC ( Muraki & Ichiyama 1982 ) , among others , support large projects generally concentrating on the translation of computer manuals .
definition.definiens: among others , support large projects generally concentrating on the translation of computer manuals

definition.sentence: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone is working on a system to translate scientific and technical articles from Japanese into English and vice versa ( Nomura et al. 1982 ) , and is looking into the future as far as simultaneous machine translation of telephone conversations ( Nomura , personal communication ) .
definition.definiens: working on a system to translate scientific and technical articles from Japanese into English and vice versa

definition.sentence: Back-up , for example , is a known problem ( Tsujii , personal communication ) : if the GETA system `` pursues a wrong path '' through the control graph of subgrammars , it can undo some of its work by backing up past whole graphs , discarding the results produced by entire subgrammars ; but within a subgrammar , there is no possibility of backing up and reversing the effects of individual rule applications .
definition.definiens: a known problem ( Tsujii , personal communication ) : if the GETA system `` pursues a wrong path '' through the control graph of subgrammars

definition.sentence: EUROTRA is a true multi-national development project .
definition.definiens: a true multi-national development project

definition.sentence: Translation here is seen as just one application ofsuch a system : the system `` understands '' natural language input , then `` generates '' natural language output ; if the languages happen to be different , then translation has been performed via paraphrase .
definition.definiens: the system `` understands '' natural language input , then `` generates '' natural language output

definition.sentence: For the computer scientist , COMSKEE is a procedural ( imperative ) format-free , block-oriented programming language such as ALGOL and Pascal , yet comprising some of the qualities of functional languages ( such as LISP or PROLOG ) .
definition.definiens: a procedural ( imperative ) format-free , block-oriented programming language such as ALGOL and Pascal , yet comprising some of the qualities of functional languages ( such as LISP or PROLOG )

definition.sentence: PHASE III determines the syntactic functions within the sentence , using syntactic and semantic criteria , and carries out the semantic disambiguation of lexemes .
definition.definiens: determines the syntactic functions within the sentence , using syntactic and semantic criteria , and carries out the semantic disambiguation of lexemes

definition.sentence: Beyond the phase of analysis , ASCOF includes a phase of transfer and synthesis , where the words of the source language are exchanged for those of the target language and where simultaneously structures are altered in the tree structure if necessary .
definition.definiens: includes a phase of transfer and synthesis

definition.sentence: The component SUB , operating in the preverbal field , defines subjects of nondominated verbs as well as possibly occurring pronominal complements ; dominated verbs ( e.g. , causative constructions ) are analyzed by another component , not described in this paper ( INFSUB , cf. Stegentritt ( 1982 , 1984 ) ) .
definition.definiens: operating in the preverbal field , defines subjects of nondominated verbs as well as possibly occurring pronominal complements ; dominated verbs ( e.g. , causative constructions

definition.sentence: K1 is the less sophisticated complex , identifying nothing but direct complements which it recognizes merely by form and prepositional complements obligatorily demanded by the verb .
definition.definiens: the less sophisticated complex , identifying nothing but direct complements which it recognizes merely by form and prepositional complements obligatorily demanded by the verb

definition.sentence: The task of the analysis of complex noun phrases ( multinuclear nounand prepositional phrases ) is to identify their boundaries and to describe their internal structures , i.e. , to determine the syntactic-functional relations between the various parts of the complex .
definition.definiens: to identify their boundaries and to describe their internal structures

definition.sentence: apposition ( AP ) : a paratactic relation on the level of syntactic analysis ( du froment tendre , plante comestible qui . . . ) hypotactic relations of phrases depending on the head : prepositional complement/object ( PO ) : signalizes a very close relation between two phrases ; the preposition of the second phrase is mostly synsemantic ; the PO and the inflectional case of the two languages ( French , German ) frequently correspond to each other ( la voix de son mattredie Stimme seines Herrn ) .
definition.definiens: a paratactic relation on the level of syntactic analysis
signalizes a very close relation between two phrases

definition.sentence: \ ] prepositional complement/part of a compound ( PC ) : impfies an even closer unity of the two phrases ; PC and the governing phrase , in contrast to other structural units , represent primary units often functioning as a one-nucleus phrase ; this is of great importance to the language pair French and German , the complex phrase in French being equivalent to a German oneword compound ( e.g. , la notation de base Basisnotation ) prepositional attribute ( PA ) : signals a relatively free relation to position and introductory preposition , which is always autosemantic ; for this reason , the PA may assume many different semantic values ( e.g. , temporal or local attribute , etc. ) un groupe simple g~ l'intdrieur du syntagme ) .
definition.definiens: impfies an even closer unity of the two phrases ; PC and the governing phrase , in contrast to other structural units , represent primary units often functioning as a one-nucleus phrase

definition.sentence: These phrases consist of the head on the left and a dependent phrase on the right which is connected with this head .
definition.definiens: consist of the head on the left and a dependent phrase on the right which is connected with this head

definition.sentence: NOMAL is a procedural ( sub ) system similar to an ATN .

In order to isolate correct structural descriptions as soon as possible , cross-connections between syntax and semantics are established by the ASCOF system ( cf. available for the identification of syntactic-functional relations and that , vice versa , syntactic and functional relations can be used for semantic interpretation ( disambiguation ) .
definition.definiens: structural descriptions as soon as possible , cross-connections between syntax and semantics are established by the ASCOF system ( cf. available for the identification of syntactic-functional relations and that , vice versa

definition.sentence: ISA edges , which define a special implicit relation , are important for two reasons .
definition.definiens: define a special implicit relation , are important for two reasons

definition.sentence: AND ORGANISAT1ON EUROTRA is a research and development programme of the European Communities .
TRA is a binary relation , consisting of pairs of texts \ [ Ts , Tt\ ] where Tt is a translation of Ts .
definition.definiens: a binary relation , consisting of pairs of texts \ [ Ts

definition.sentence: AN , TRF , and GEN are all binary relations : AN _ < SLxp , GEN < pxTL , and TRF _ < pxp We define the composition AN o TRF o GEN as the set of pairs \ [ Ts , Tt\ ] such that there exist Rs and Rt such that Ts AN Rs and Rs TRF Rt and Rt GEN Tt .
definition.definiens: the composition AN o TRF o GEN as the set of pairs \ [ Ts

definition.sentence: We will restrict our attention to those cases where AN oTRFoGEN = TRA Analysis , transfer , and generation are systems that compute the relations AN , TRF , and GEN. For the reasons given in the previous section , EUROTRA tries to produce a detailed specification of the contents of the relations as input to the research teams that write the computational systems .
definition.definiens: tries to produce a detailed specification of the contents of the relations as input to the research teams that write the computational systems

definition.sentence: TRF is a subset of translates-as : it is the set of those elements of translates-as for which the left-hand term is the topmost node of a representation of a complete text .
definition.definiens: a subset of translates-as : it is the set of those elements of translates-as for which the left-hand term is the topmost node of a representation of a complete text

definition.sentence: Computational Linguistics , Volume 11 , Numbers 2-3 , April-September 1985 159 Rod Johnson , Maghi King , and Louis des Tombe EUROTRA ( 4 ) / \ o P • Tom/\ B ... .. F C ... ... ... ... ... ... ... ... I ( Tom ) om/ D ... .. g E ... .. 0 tzwem ) ( swim ) ( g~aag ) Q R A ( likeA O K S 1 ( lik~ ( emptg ) ( swim ) L M ( emptg ) ( swim ) Translates-as is a straightforward generalization from two notions that have already existed for a long time in various machine translation projects : • TRF , which is the same relation but only between root nodes of representations of whole texts ; • the bilingual dictionary , which is the same relation but only between terminal nodes .

If A translates-as A t , then we will call A t a TN of A. We now call an element \ [ s , t\ ] of the set defined by translates-as a simple element iff either s and t are both terminal nodes , or ( i ) and ( ii ) and ( iii ) and ( iv ) s is a subtree , whose root node is the nonterminal node A. t is a tree , whose root node is A p , A p is a copy of A , the immediate daughters of A ' are copies of the TNs of the immediate daughters of A. 160 Computational Linguistics , Volume 1 !
definition.definiens: call A t a TN of A. We now call an element \ [ s , t\ ] of the set defined by translates-as a simple element iff either s
a copy of A , the immediate daughters of A ' are copies of the TNs of the immediate daughters of A. 160 Computational Linguistics

definition.sentence: In EUROTRA , there are three of them : • the EUROTRA Morphological level ( EM ) • the EUROTRA Surface Syntactic level ( ESS ) , the EUROTRA Deep Syntactic level ( EDS ) Third , there is the Interface structure , intended to be the level at which transfer ( i.e. , simple transfer ) takes place normally .
definition.definiens: the level at which transfer ( i.e. , simple transfer ) takes place normally

definition.sentence: A dependency construction is the collection of elements consisting of one gov and all its dependents .
definition.definiens: the collection of elements consisting of one gov and all its dependents

definition.sentence: It is then a member of two constructions , as described informally : nrl I I I Construction John tried to swim nr2 '' I \ ] The element John is a member of two constructions ; this is impossible to represent in the form of a tree .
definition.definiens: a member of two constructions

definition.sentence: given A ( B+C ( X*+D+Y*+E+Z* ) where cat ( A ) =S and cat ( B ) =NP and cat ( C ) =VP and cat ( D ) =V and cat ( E ) =NP build P ( Q+R+X*+Y*+Z* ) where srel ( P ) =pred and srel ( Q ) =subj and srel ( Q ) =obj and lex ( P ) =lex ( D ) and lex ( Q ) =lex ( B ) and lex ( R ) =lex ( E ) and semf ( P ) =semf ( D ) and semf ( Q ) =semf ( B ) and semf ( R ) =semf ( E ) /* semf stands for `` semantic feature '' , X* , Y* , Z* are intended to stand for variables over sequences of trees */ followed again later by given A ( B+C ) where srel ( A ) =pred and srel ( B ) =subj and srel ( C ) =obj and action-process in semf ( A ) and animate in semf ( B ) build A ( B+C ) adding case ( A ) =pred and case ( B ) =agent and case ( C ) =patient While the above notation is very informal , it is worth noting the very arbitrary semantics that underly it .
definition.definiens: A ) and animate in semf ( B ) build A ( B+C ) adding case ( A ) =pred and case ( B ) =agent and case

definition.sentence: Non-primitive bodies consist of expressions over the names of processes , where the meaning of the expression can be varied by external definitions .
definition.definiens: consist of expressions over the names of processes
